name: Walter Brennan Movies Quiz | People Themed | 10 Questions

questions.text: Brennan appeared with Henry Fonda in "My Darling Clementine". What role did he play?
questions.explanation:
One of the Clantons.

	Fonda played Wyatt Earp and Victor Mature played Holliday. Brennan was "Old Man" Clanton. Ward Bond and Linda Darnell round out the cast.

questions.text: Brennan worked with John Wayne in "Rio Bravo". Who was NOT in the movie with him?
questions.explanation:
Linda Darnell.

	Nelson and Martin play deputies to Wayne's sheriff; Dickinson is the romantic interest for Wayne. Darnell was in "My Darling Clementine".

questions.text: Brennan worked with Gary Cooper in "Meet John Doe". Who played the female lead?
questions.explanation:
Barbara Stanwyck.

	Stanwyck plays a pushy reporter; Cooper (and Brennan) represent the "common man".

questions.text: Brennan starred with Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall in "To Have and Have Not". Who wrote the story on which the movie was based?
questions.explanation:
Ernest Hemingway.

	Bogart and Bacall and Brennan struggle with Nazis during WW II. (Hoagy Carmichael was also in the cast.) Bogart had better movies in his future.

questions.text: Brennan appeared in which of these comedies?
questions.explanation:
Support Your Local Sheriff.

	"Sheriff" starred James Garner; Brennan played a tough guy (of sorts) in this slight western comedy. "Texas" starred Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin, "McClintock" starred John Wayne, "Wheeler" also starred James Garner.

questions.text: Brennan starred in "The Westerner". Which famous western figure did he portray?
questions.explanation:
Judge Roy Bean.

	It was a good performance, but a forgettable movie. (Gary Cooper was in this one, too.)

questions.text: Brennan worked with Gary Cooper again in "Pride of the Yankees". To whom does the title refer?
questions.explanation:
Lou Gehrig.

	This is one of Cooper's best films. Brennan does his usual good job in this tale of baseball glory and a life cut short. Ruth and Dickey appear in the movie.

questions.text: Brennan worked again with John Wayne in "Red River". The action of the movie involves what event?
questions.explanation:
Cattle drive.

	Wayne plays a too-tough leader of a cattle drive; Montgomery Clift has one of his earliest starring roles.

questions.text: Brennan worked with Spencer Tracy in "Bad Day at Black Rock". What role did he play?
questions.explanation:
Doctor.

	Brennan plays the doctor in this fine Spencer Tracy film that includes Robert Ryan, Ernest Borgnine, Lee Marvin, Anne Francis and Dean Jagger in the cast.

questions.text: Brennan worked again with Gary Cooper in "Sergeant York". York became a hero during what war?
questions.explanation:
World War I.

	Alvin York became a celebrity as a result of his service during WW I.
